channel.title: Chungcheongnam-do on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Seosan, Chungcheongnam-do, running freely in the vast tidal flats and fields - Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea
item.description:
Children who feel the mud flat and smile

Seosan, Chungcheongnam-do, running freely in the vast tidal flats and fields

Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea

<Car travel distance>
Jung-ri Village Experience Village → 25 minutes by car 18km → Jungang Lake Park → 30 minutes by car 22km → Seosan Birdland → 8 minutes by car 5km → Ganwol-do (Ganwolam) → 22 minutes by car 20km → Seosan Ryubangtaek Astronomical Meteorological Science Museum → 25 minutes by car 20km → Haemi-eupseong
Seosan, Chungnam where you can see the rich nature. Seosan is the place where you can meet sea creatures, migratory birds and their stories from the vast tidal flats, and play freely in the fields in the old castle. Children's dreams will shine on brightly lit planets with pouring stars. Seosan is a place that presents health to children with natural spices instead of artificial sweeteners.
"Mom, I found the clams again!", Jungliao Village Experience Village
'Tidal Flat', where the sea water is missing, transforms into the best natural learning place. Located in Jigok-myeon, Seosan-si, 'Jerieo Village Experience Village' is one of the world's top five clean tidal flats and is full of various attractions, food, and experiences, making it a perfect place for families traveling with children.
Jungliao Village Experience Village located in Jigok-myeon, Seosan-si
This small fishing village with about 170 people in 120 households was introduced to KBS2 '1 night 2 days' program and was widely known.
Jungliao Village Experience Village Office
Children enter the tidal flats in Garorim Bay and are excited first.
Tidal flat experience boots
Accept boots, hoe, and mesh that fit your feet, and hold your hands as you go to tidal flat.
Children walking to the tidal flat
From the experience office, take the electric cart to the tidal flat, and even if you dig a little bit of soil with a hoe, the tight clams pour out.
Electric cart for tidal movement
One year, there were so many clams that I couldn't control even if I didn't buy it.
Children picking up clams with a hoe
The place where there are many clams is called 'pants' base, but when you walk there, the sound of 'pants and pants' sounds at your feet.
A family unit experience visitor who visited Jung-ri village on the weekend
Avoid the place where the water is filled because the boots are easy to fall into the tidal flat. If there is a guardian, it is an experience without age restrictions.
Hand-picked clams
In addition, there are various programs such as 뻘 octopus experience, foot net experience, and can train ride experience.
A child who washes his clams out in sea water
After the experience, you can wash the mud at the waterside and change children's clothes on the 2nd floor of the Fishermen's Happiness Hall next to the experience office.
Kid washing the mud
Make sure you have a plastic bag to hold your spare clothes and dirty clothes. It is also a good idea to bring a snack for the child who will go out after the experience.
Feeding room and fishermen's hall where you can return
Here is not the end. There is a village tour by electric train. In the Seosan Creative Art Village, which transformed the closed school into an art space, all exhibits that recycled the scraps are spread across the playground.
Seosan Creative Art Village
It is also possible to experience salting. It is a natural learning ground by collecting white grains of salt, entering a salt warehouse and touching natural salt.
Salt warehouse at Yeom-jeon
Seosan Citizen's Garden, Central Lake Park
Jungang Lake Park is a garden of Seosan and a resting place for citizens. It is a place to relax for a while while traveling to Seosan. You can take a baby stroller and walk on the deck.
Seosan Garden, Jungang Lake Park
There are restaurants, convenience facilities, and cafes for infants and toddlers nearby. In the cafe for infants and toddlers, the beautiful scenery of Joongang Lake Park can be seen at a glance.
Inside the cafe for infants and toddlers
It is also a place where children can eat, toys, and a variety of items to cope with emergencies.
Sale of various baby goods in cafes
Migratory Bird Sanctuary, Seosan Bird Land
After passing through the Ganwol Intersection, you can see a pyramid decorated with colorful glass. It is a signboard of birds flying away from the cold in Siberia.
Seosan Bird Land
Seosan Birdland is a platform that protects only the world-famous migratory bird, Cheonsu, and meets birds.
Electric vehicles used by families
At the Migratory Bird Museum, you can meet about 200 kinds of stuffed migratory birds, including the typical migratory birds that visit Cheonsu Bay, such as Gachang Duck, Big Geese, and Yellow Beak Spoonbill.
Inside the Migratory Museum
Be sure to listen to the funny stories of the birds from the ecological commentator. (From 11:00, you can listen to the comment for about 20 minutes at every hour except lunch time.)
Children experiencing multimedia (people and birds)
Just as children memorize difficult dinosaur names for adults, birds are surprisingly well distinguished by adults.
Tree of central stairs
Following the guideline marked with a new footstep, the children see their colorful birds, flap their arms and flap.
A child experiencing multimedia (a bird in culture and art)
On the stairs leading to the exhibition hall on the 2nd floor, you can see birds flying, flowers and trees growing with multi-vision installed on the wall.
A child who chooses experience materials
Children's favorite space is just going up and down.
Children who experience coloring
Various experience classes are also available. During the experience of making new models, making ecological clocks, matching puzzles, and tactile play boxes, the ecological interpreter helps children experience and tells new stories related to them.
Complete the mirror making experience
Inside the Pyramid is a 4D movie theater that shows animations (about 17 minutes) on topics related to birds. It is a place where children are most excited by adding realistic experiences such as vibration, water, and wind in existing 3D movies. Admission is restricted for infants, pregnant women, and patients with heart history less than 36 months old.
4D movie theater
The nest observatory is made of circular spaces of various sizes that symbolize migratory birds. As you climb, only Cheonsu spreads out. Cheonsuman literally means shallow sea, shallow water, literally shallow water.
Exhibition Hall and Nest Observatory
It is now a reclamation site made by filling tidal flats. It has become a farmland where 500,000 people can eat rice for a year. So, winter migratory birds fly to Cheonsu Bay, which has abundant prey. The residents do not forget to care for taking care of the birds of prey by deliberately placing them. Don't miss Seosan Birdland, where you can learn how to grow with nature through stories of birds that are always close to us.
View of the nursing room in the canteen
Ganwolam, hermitage floating on water
It takes about 10 minutes by car to arrive at Ganwol-do.
Gwanwolam, High tide
Ganwol-do was the passage of the Goryeo era messengers to the Song Dynasty or the Song Dynasty messengers from Nanjing to the land of Goryeo.
Hermitage floating on the water, Ganwolam
I'm looking for Ganwol-do because of Ganwol-am, which can be found twice a day if the seawater falls. It is famous for hermitage floating on the water.
Ganwolam, where the road was revealed at low tide
Ganwolam erected a hermitage to commemorate the Buddha's success, where Mangung Mangung, who revived Sudeoksa Temple, was here.
Ganwolam Precinct
It is also good to see Gwanwol Island, which is also proud of the West Coast and Seosan. As the children feel cold in the sea breeze, prepare a windscreen or thick clothes. To go to Ganwolam, you need to get a good time. You can also kindly inquire at the Tourism Division of Seosan City before your visit, and be sure to check it out when searching through the Internet.
Ganwolam Sunset
There are a lot of 'Eori Guljeot' sold at the entrance to Ganwoldo. Oysters stop growing when the seawater is drained. In Gwanwol-do, where the difference between the tide and the tide is large, they are buried in the tidal flat for 4 to 7 hours, receiving sunlight, and they are much more savory than other local oysters due to the moderate temperature and salinity. Children don't know the salty salty taste yet, but it's a delicacy for adults traveling together.
Pillar Buddha face sculpture
Starry Night, Seosan-ryu Bangtaek Astronomical Meteorological Museum
It is too early to turn to the hostel. It's time to see the stars and shining planets that fill the night sky of Seosan.
Seosan Ryubang Astronomical Meteorological Museum
Seosan Ryubangtaek Astronomical Meteorological Museum is not well known, but if you go there, you will be surprised by Ryu Bangtaek's achievements.
Photo zone at the entrance
Let's open the back of the ten thousand won bill in your wallet. If you look closely at the background pattern, you can see the map of the celestial train field, the main astronomical map of Joseon, behind Honcheon. This map, designated as National Treasure No. 228, was produced by a teacher named Geum Heon Ryu Bang-taek from Seosan, Chungnam. It is the second oldest in the world to depict the entire sky, and it is the first Jeoncheon Seokgakdo to express its size differently according to the brightness of the stars. You can learn more in the exhibition room on the first floor, which is free of charge.
The Big Dipper of the Heavenly Train Field Map
The first floor consists of an astronomical projection room, an exhibition education room, and a chromakey experience space. You can observe the sunspots and red flames of the ocean and various astronomical objects in the main observation room and auxiliary observation room on the second floor.
Auxiliary observation room
Admission is 3,000 won for adults and children under 6 are free. It can be used from 2pm to 10pm during the winter season (September to April), and from 3pm to 11pm during the summer season (May to August). However, since daily observations vary depending on the weather, check by phone before visiting.
1st floor exhibition hall
Again At Park Myeong hours (17: 30 ~ 19: 30), neither the stars nor the sun can be observed, so you can only see the permanent exhibition hall. Infants under the age of 36 months are not admitted to the astronomical observation room and the astronomical projection room.
Ryu Bang-taek feed museum
Haemi-eup Castle, a playground in the wall that seems to have stopped time

Seosanhaemi-eupseong, one of the representative cities of Korea, is located in Haemi, which means that the sea is beautiful.

Haemi-eupseong Fortress
In 1416, Taejong was staying in Haemi for a day after doing military training at Dobisan in Seosan.
Jinnammun

It boasts the most complete form of the castle. If you look at the castle stone on the outer wall of the castle, each village name, such as Gongju, Cheongju, and Imcheon, is engraved.

The name of the village 'Princess' engraved on the castle wall
After passing the main gate of the castle, Jinnammun, you can see painting trees and jade in a straight line, and Dongheon and guest houses are at the end.
Haemi-eupseong Painting Tree
Because the children are good to play like in a field, there are many group tours from the nearby daycare centers.
Eupseong Guest House
You can also take a stroll around the town with children in a flower cart.
Children who come as a group
Every Saturday from April to October, there are performances such as North Korea, Samulnori, and tightrope walking. Folk games and folk experiences are also free.
Couple of haemicheon riverside
From March to October, it is open until 9:00 pm, and you can tour the town from late. In addition, there are many restaurants nearby, and you can take a walk around the Haemicheon River, making it a popular spot for citizens.
Flag of Haemi-eup
Travel information

Recommended travel course (same day course)

Jung-ri Village Experience Village → Joongang Lake Park → Lunch → Seosan Birdland (Museum Bird Museum) → Ganwol-do (Ganwolam) → Seosan Ryubangtaek Astronomy and Meteorological Museum


Recommended travel course (2 nights 3 days course)

first day : Jungri Village Experience Village (Yeomcheol Experience, Seosan Creative Art Village) → Lunch → Seosan Birdland (4D movie viewing and making experience) → Ganwoldo (Ganwolam) → Dinner and lodging
Second day : Haemi-eupseong → Haemicheon River Walk → Lunch → Gaeshimsa Temple (May Yoshino Cherry Blossoms and Blue Cherry Blossoms) → Seosan Yonghyeon-ri Maae Three Buddha Statue → National Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest → Dinner and Seosan Ryubang Takcheon Astronomical Science Museum
third day : Walk through Jungang Lake Park → Como Baby Cafe (for infants under 36 months old) → Lunch → Organic house → Yeomi Gallery & Café


question

-Jung-ri Village Experience Village: 041-665-9498, 010-6408-7665 / http://www.seantour.com/village/jungri/main/

-Seosan Bird Land: 041-661-8054 / http://www.seosanbirdland.kr/

-Ganwol-do: 041-660-2114 (Cultural Tourism Division, Seosan City Hall), 041-668-6624 (Ganwolam)

-Seosan Ryubang Astronomical Meteorological Museum: 041-669-8496 / http://www.ryubangtaek.or.kr/

-Haemi-eupseong: 041-660-2540 (Haemi-eupseong Management Office)

-Sangwangsan Open Retreat: 041-688-2256

-Seosan Culture & Tourism: 041-660-2114 / http://www.seosan.go.kr/tour/index.do

-National Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest: 041-664-1978 (Recreation Forest Management Office)

-Seosan Organic House: 041-663-4326


Barrier-free information


-Jungri Village Experience Village

* Clam experience (April to November), Cost: 10,000 won for adults (including rental of hoe and boots), 5,000 won for children

※ Village tour experience (Seosan creative arts village, village attractions such as salt farm tour) included

* Indigo net experience (April to November), cost: 10,000 won (including equipment and boots rental fee)

* Fishing rod fishing experience (April to November), Cost: 30,000 won for adults, 10,000 won for children (including one fishing rod rental per person)

※ Experience is subject to change depending on the tide and local circumstances, so it is necessary to refer to the website and call before visiting.

* After feeding and experience, return is possible at Fisherman Happiness Hall (2nd floor)

* No age limit for experience when accompanied by a guardian

* Boots rental included for experience

* Accommodation available for fishermen's happiness


-Seosan Bird Land

* Stroller rental (free)

* Nursing room at the kiosk in the Migratory Museum (equipment of hot and cold water purifiers and diapers, baby beds, and feeding cushions)

* There is a diaper changing table in the bathroom

* It is possible to move from the ticket office to the exhibition hall by electric vehicle in Seosan Birdland.

* 4D movie theater (less than 36 months and pregnant women are not allowed to visit)

* No restaurant inside (sale of confectionery and cup ramen in the shop)

* Experience cost: making a new model (4,000 ~ 5,000 won), making an ecological clock (8,000 won), matching a puzzle, tactile play box (free)

* 4D movie theater admission fee 2,000 won for adults and 1,000 won for children


-Seosan Ryubang Astronomical Meteorological Museum

* Stroller and wheelchair rental (free)

*...

* There is a nursing room (diaper changing table, crib, sofa)

* Opening hours: Winter season (September to April): 14:00 to 22:00, Summer season (May to August): 15:00 to 23:00

* Admission: Adults 3,000 won, free for children under 6 years old (free on the 1st floor permanent exhibition hall)


-Haemi-eupseong

* Stroller and wheelchair rental (free), inquiries in the management office

* Parking area for pregnant women (no parking fee)

* Open year round and free admission

* Many cafes and restaurants in and around Eupseong


-Ganwol-do

* Can enter Ganwolam during low tide

* Required to check when biting: http://www.badatime.com/ Or Seosan City Tourism Culture Division

Move information

Public transportation information

-[Bus] Operates 48 times a day (06: 05 ~ 21: 50) from Seoul-Seosan, Central City Terminal, approximately 20 minutes between trains. It takes 1 hour and 50 minutes. Departs from Seoul Nambu Terminal and East Seoul General Terminal

* question

Central City Terminal 02-6282-0114

Easy Ticket www.hticket.co.kr


Self-driving information

-Depart from Seoul City Hall → Dongjak Bridge → Gangnam Circulation City Expressway → Geumcheon Tollgate (toll 1,600 won) → Soha Junction at Seohaean Expressway → Turn right at Haemi IC toward 'Seosan, Haemi'

Food and lodging information

Rooms

-Kim Ki-hyun's house : 45, Hadanari-gil, Eumam-myeon, Seosan-si / 010-3045-8273 / Designated as a luxury house in 2013 / Accommodating 4 love rooms in Haengrang (Ocher room; there is a toilet in the room and shower is available. There is a kitchenette where you can cook and eat next to the room)

http://m.gyeam.net/

http://blog.naver.com/gyeam/


-Zero Place : 367-19, Ilrakgol-gil, Haemi-myeon, Seosan-si / 041-688-5550 / 3 km from Haemi-eupseong toward Ilrak-sa / Pick-up service provided at Haemi-stop / Cafe on the 1st floor / Barbecue available / Large front yard / https://www.facebook.com/zer0place


-Seosan Hotel : 17, Eupnae 2-ro, Seosan-si / 041-669-4125 / Opened in March 2017 / Free ramen vending machine, toast and coffee in the lobby / Nearby Seosan Lake Park and Seosan Eastern Market / https://blog.naver.com/november_hotel


Restaurants near

-Geun Village Yeongyang Gulbab: Gulbab / 65, Ganwol-do 1-gil, Buseok-myeon, Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do / 041-662-2706 / Snack table / No side dishes provided / No baby tableware

-Dongmyeong Banjeom: Jajangmyeon, Tangsuyuk / 137 Goun-ro, Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do / 041-666-2532 / Seating table / No baby chairs, seating table available

-Jingukjip: Geukjiji Baekban / 19-10 Gwanamun-gil, Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do / 041-665-7091 / Local restaurant / No.1 Plaza Intersection / No parking


※ The above information was created in April 2017, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.

item.title: A trip to the sea in Taean, that's about it! - Taean-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea
item.description:
Inside the Konam Shell Museum

A trip to the sea in Taean, that's about it!

Taean-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea

<Full travel path>
Gonam Shell Museum → 20 minutes by car, 11km → Anmyeondo Natural Recreation Forest → 15 minutes by car → 3.6km → Cafe Isle-2 minutes by car, 1km → Flower Land Coast Park → 1 hour and 10 minutes by car, 51km → Cheonnipo Arboretum → 25 minutes by car, 13km → Sinduri Sand Dunes → 40 minutes by car, 28km → Farm Camomile Herb Farm
The West Sea is full of things that 'Donghae' does not have. The arithmetic depth does not match the East Sea, but it is deeper than any deep sea when approaching the chest. Not the hot and energetic sunrise of the East Sea, but the relaxing and calm afternoon colors, and the scenery like relaxation at sunset at dusk. . Unlike the rough and cool East Sea, the West Sea is full of calmness and calmness, and the West Sea is filled with the smell of the depths of our lives.
Taean, which has been known as a peaceful and comfortable town since ancient times, is a representative tourist spot on the west coast that retains the beauty of the west sea. The wonderful beach path spreads casually, and you can enjoy the spectacular sunset from anywhere. The picturesque scenery that unfolds with numerous islands in harmony shows why this is Taeanhaean National Park.
Konam Shell Museum with Sea View
Opened in 2002, the Konam Shell Museum exhibits a variety of shell mound artifacts, including excavated and investigated remains of the Neolithic Era, and various tools made of earthenware, stoneware, bones, and clams.
Konam Shell Museum
There is a permanent exhibition hall, a video room, an experiential exhibition room, an exhibition hall equipped with an experiential learning room, and a second exhibition hall displaying artifacts related to agriculture, fishing, and harvesting in Taean.
The ramp to the first exhibition hall
The artifacts found in the shells are the main sights, but various experiences such as fishing, trick art, photo albums, making shellfish hats, matching earthenware puzzles, and tuhu are also popular.
foot...
There are two parking spaces for the disabled and one parking area for pregnant women in the closest to the exhibition hall, and there are wide and gentle slopes at the entrances of the first and second exhibition halls.
Seashell hat decoration experience
Another advantage is that there is no step inside the exhibition hall. However, the ramp going down from the second exhibition hall to the yard needs some help from Gapala assistants.
Museum courtyard tuho amusement facilities
There are two wheelchairs and two strollers for rent, and there is a toilet for both men and women with disabilities in the first exhibition hall.
Exhibition Hall 1 Disabled Toilet
Anmyeonsong Healing Spot, Anmyeondo Natural Recreation Forest
It is a place where you can see some of the best pine forests in the country. In Korea, 135ha of wonderful forests, which are the only pine trees around 100 years old, fill the recreational forest.
Sol Forest Trail
Pine trees native to Anmyeondo are especially called 'Anmyeonsong' and have been in the spotlight as luxury pine trees since ancient times.
Disabled parking area close to promenade
There are various courses that you can take a walk along the evergreen pine forest. For a wheelchair, a walkway of 500 m or more from the ticket office to the Forest Hall is good.
Pine Trail View
There are six disabled parking areas near the promenade, and three wheelchairs are available at the ticket office. There are toilets for the disabled, one for both men and women, in the bathrooms behind the parking lot kiosk and in the bathrooms across the parking lot.
Arboretum
The walkway from the ticket office to the Forest Hall is generally gentle. In some sections, slopes require steep supporters.
Flat road leading to the Forest Exhibition Hall
'Café Isle', which adds coffee aroma to the aroma of the sea
'Café Isle' on Kkotji Beach is a romantic place with a wide window full of beautiful West Sea.
Cafe Isle with ramps
It is a small cafe with only three or four tables, but the sea through the window is wider and greener than anywhere else.
Inside the cafe with both sides of glass
If the day is good, it is better to enjoy the calm West Sea without clogging. There seems to be no place like this because of the rest during the trip.
Cafe Isle's Outdoor Terrace

There is a parking space right in front of the cafe entrance, and a ramp is installed on the way to the cafe. There is no chin on the door, so it is easy to go in and out, and there is no problem in moving inside the cafe, which is not spacious. However, there is a small gravel on the floor of the parking lot, so an assistant is needed when entering the cafe from the car. The toilet has a chin and is narrow, so it is difficult to use it while in a wheelchair.

Flower Island Beach in front of Cafe Isle
The sunset of Kkotji Beach to be seen once in a lifetime
There is a saying that 'the person who has seen a lot of the scenery that is falling is really rich'. Flower garden is one of the three sunset spots in Korea.
Bench with a good view of the grandmother and grandmother
CNN was also considered a beautiful place to visit in Korea.
Grandmother and Grandmother Rock Information Board
The sunset scenery that falls over the grandmother's rock and the grandmother's rock, conveyed by the sad legend of Mido, the wife who became a mess while waiting for the return of the soldiers and the return of a soldier, is a masterpiece.
The sun falling to the side of the grandmother's rock
There is a two-lane road between the parking lot and the coastal park overlooking the Ghalmi-Habibi Rock, so be careful of vehicles when crossing.
Disabled parking area in coastal park
There are 18 handicapped parking areas near the coastal park, and there is a toilet with toilets for disabled men and women on either side of the parking lot.
Disabled toilet ramp near parking lot
There is no step at the entrance to the coastal park.
Entrance to coastal park without steps
If you are looking for a flower at sunset, you need to be careful about keeping warm. If you prepare a blanket or hot pack in advance, this is a little warmer while waiting for the sun to set.
Grandmother's and Grandmother's Rock Sunset at Flower Land Coastal Park
Secret Garden, Cheonnipo Arboretum, returned after 40 years
Cheonnipo Arboretum has various titles, including the first private arboretum in Korea and the certification of “the world's first beautiful arboretum” in Asia.
'Road without stairs' in Cheonnipo Arboretum
It is the largest botanical garden in Korea with 15,800 plant species, including native plants in Korea and imported species from more than 60 countries around the world.It was originally a private arboretum for research purposes, but was released to the public since 2009.
Nakwoosong, a beauty tree in the arboretum
Founded in 1921 in Pennsylvania, USA, it was founded by Min Byung-Gal, who became a Korean in 1979.
Cheonnipo Arboretum is easy to move with deck
In the arboretum, there is a separate “route without stairs” that goes around the arboretum, including the main space.
Trails with Cheonnipo Beach
This route is suitable for a wheelchair tour. However, there are some slopes in the middle, and assistance is needed.
Waterway with wooden boards considering wheelchair users
In addition, a braille plate engraved on a stainless steel plate is attached to the guide plate, and a wooden plate is placed on the cover of the waterway crossing the road so that a wheelchair can pass.
Disabled parking area under construction
This is a place where caring for the disabled is felt everywhere.
Observation deck with a view of Cheonpopo Sea
There are 5 parking spaces for the disabled across the road in front of the ticket office, and there are toilets for the disabled in 4 toilets, including a parking lot, an entrance, a cafe, and a hollyhock house.
A ramp leading to the toilet next to the holly tree house
“Is Korea right here?” Moving sand dune, Sinduri coastal dune
The Sindu-ri coastal sand dune is 3.4 km long and 0.5-1.3 km wide, making it the largest and largest coastal dune in Korea.
‘Room to attach a wish’ located on the 1st basement level of Sinduri Sand Dunes
It was designated as Natural Monument No. 431 in 2001, and is called the “Korean Desert”.
The road from Sinduri Sand Dune Center to the sand dune entrance
The animals and plants inhabiting here, such as Gojiri-sacho, Gaegyeongryeong, Sunbiki, gourd dust worm, ant ghost, 삵, and baby hornbill, are more unusual because they are rarely seen.
Rooftop of Sinduri Sand Dune Center
It is a good idea to visit the Sinduri Sand Dunes Center at the entrance before visiting the coastal sand dunes.
Sinduri Sand Dunes and Course A Trail
After exploring the sand dune center, go to the back gate, and the trail leads.
A course deck with sea and coastal dunes at a glance
Of the roads leading from the back gate of the Sand Dunes Center to the trail, the 100m area is unpaved, making it difficult to move by wheelchair. The trail is made of a wooden deck, but there is a rise and fall, so an assistant is required.
Sinduri Sand Dunes Center Entrance
There are five disabled parking areas in front of the Sinduri Sand Dune Center, and there are toilets for disabled men and women on the 1st and 1st basement levels of the Sinduri Sand Dune Center. Facilities are good.
Disabled parking area in front of Sinduri Sand Dune Center
There are a total of 3 trails in Sinduri Coastal Sand Dunes. Of these, the 1.2km A course is suitable for a wheelchair tour.
Disabled toilet in Sinduri Sand Dune Center
Farm Camomile Herb Farm that seems to have transformed a European garden
The Farm Camomile Herb Farm, with its exotic scenery, is a large forest with a wide variety of themed gardens in restaurants, herb shops, campgrounds, and pensions.
Straw sculpture at the entrance
The Herb Shop Studio, which sells several products made from herbs directly produced by the plantation, and a nice cafe and restaurant are close to the entrance.
Herb Shop Studio
Even if there is not enough space for a wheelchair, it is enough to have a time of healing while admiring the pretty garden.
Road from ticket office to garden
It is a pity that most of the 12 charming gardens are located on a hilltop and cannot be explored in a wheelchair.
Herb Shop Studio
There is no step on the road between the gardens, but it is slightly uncomfortable to move in a wheelchair because it has a green Pytex flooring instead of pavement. Activity assistants are required.
Castle Garden with an impressive pyrancan fruit
The disabled parking area is not separated. There is one toilet for men and women with disabilities in the hub shop studio behind the ticket office.
Handicapped toilet in the herb shop studio
Accommodation information for ‘handicapped rooms’
One of the recommended accommodations in Anmyeondo and Cheonnipo Beach in Taean-gun is the Long Beach Family Hotel, which embraces Manripo Beach. It is a Manripo beach with a large white sandy beach in front of the hotel, and you can enjoy the cool West Sea scenery through the wide window of the room.
Disability Parking Area and No Stepped Entrance
It is a new building built in summer 2017, and all facilities are neat. There are two handicapped parking areas right in front of the front door, and when you enter the front door without any steps, there is a handicapped room in front of you.
Spacious disabled rooms
When moving in and out of the bathroom and room, there is no chin to move, and the spacious room is easy to use by wheelchair. Safety bars are installed wherever you need them.
Stepless and spacious toilet
The rooms are equipped with four-person dining tables and kitchen appliances such as rice cookers, microwave ovens, and medium-sized refrigerators. There is a barbecue table on the veranda, so it is good to enjoy tea while watching the sea.
Manripo sea from your room
Restaurants with wheelchair access
'Mom's Table' at Baeksajang Port, the head of Anmyeondo Island, is a place where you can taste delicacies made from all kinds of seafood from the West Sea. There are also fresh sashimi, clam-roasted, daha-yaki, and spicy hot dishes, as well as a la carte dishes such as crab soup and blue crab soup, grilled fish, and stew. Rarely for disabled people, there is a parking area for the disabled, and there is a ramp on the stairs. However, a Gapala activity assistant is required. The toilet on the outside has a high and narrow chin, making it uncomfortable to use.
Shellfish soup
You can enjoy fresh seafood at 'Bangpohoe Town', which is the groundwork for Bangpo Port in Anmyeondo. If you choose a variety of seafood directly from ‘Bangpo Fisheries’ right next to the restaurant, you can cook sashimi in ‘Bangpohoe Town’ and boil a spicy bath to prepare a prize. After purchasing the meat, there is no step on the way to the restaurant where you cook, but the circulation is a bit complicated. It is a pity that there is no toilet for the disabled.
Urukhoe and Maeuntang
Manripo Beach's 'Honam Sashimi House' operates a fish market, and it serves as a selection of all kinds of fresh seafood from the West Sea, including various types of sashimi and tang, as well as grilled and stewed, stew, yellow haejangguk, and clam noodles. There is no chin on the door, so it is good to go in and out of a wheelchair. After parking next to the building, you need an assistant to enter the restaurant.
Grilled clams in winter

* Others: Wheelchairs (3) for rental are provided. Forest commentary program. It is generally gentle, but in some sectors, assistance from an assistant is required.

* Admission fee: None. There is a ramp.

* Toilet: No handicap toilet.


-Flower Land Coast Park

* Admission fee: None.

* Opening hours: Summer (April-October) 09: 00-18: 00, Winter season (November-March) 09: 00-17: 00. 24/7.

* Toilet: Yes. There is a disabled toilet in the toilet next to the parking lot, at the entrance of the plant center (under construction), at the cafe (male), and at the Private Memorial Hall (female), next to the holly tree house. All four.

There is a wooden deck on the sand dune trail, but there is a sloping place that requires assistance from an assistant. The section from the exit to the parking lot (250m) is also unpaved.

Low season (December to February)-6,000 won for adults, 5,000 won for senior citizens (over 65), 3,000 won for children (elementary school students), 2,000 won for infants (over 3 years old), 50% discount for the disabled.

* Toilet: There is one toilet for both men and women with disabilities in the herb shop studio.

* Others: Green Pytex flooring is installed on the floor of the parking lot and all roads accessible by wheelchairs within the plantation, so assistance is required.

item.title: Beautiful harmony of migratory birds and reeds Seocheon - Seocheon-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea
item.description:
Relaxing Seocheon Maryangpogu

Beautiful harmony of migratory birds and reeds Seocheon

Seocheon-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea

Seocheon is an impressive place with only the unique and quiet scenery unique to the countryside. The Geum River, which flows gently, crosses the body of Seocheon, and seagulls fly freely in the small muzzle. Maryangpo wakes up the morning with a throbbing sound. The Seocheon Botanical Arts Center is equipped with simple yet elegant bonsais, and you can experience the maze park and various agricultural cultures. Seosan's Hansan Ramie is one of the major essences of our national culture, which is important enough to be registered as a National Intangible Cultural Heritage No. 14 and listed as a UNESCO human intangible cultural heritage (28 November 2011). By this time, you can see the fantastic military service of migratory birds traveling to distant foreign countries. You can also whisper love in the reed forest in Sinseong-ri, where you can watch 100,000 sky up close.
The rustling wind sweeps through the reed forest. Seocheon is a place where the reed tells a rich feeling. The people of Seocheon call their place Amenity Seocheon. Amenity is said to mean all economic resources in the countryside that can satisfy people without harming the natural landscape. In other words, it will mean that we will give the best satisfaction to everyone who visits Seocheon through the unique natural scenery and cultural heritage of the countryside. Even without relying on the meaning of the dictionary, Seocheon is an impressive place with only the unique and quiet scenery unique to the countryside. The Geum River, which flows gently, crosses the body of Seocheon, and seagulls fly freely in the small muzzle. At dawn, the sound of a boat wakes up in the morning. Seosan's pride, Hansan ramie, is still the best specialty. Is that all? By this time, you can see the fantastic military service of migratory birds traveling to distant foreign countries. You can also whisper love in the reed forest in Sinseong-ri, where you can watch 100,000 shimmers up close. If you want to keep all this scenery in your mind, head out to Seocheon this weekend. A fragrant country scent will dig into your heart.
Misty morning in Seocheon Reed Forest
Seocheon is a place that gives the impression of a perfect countryside. As you walk along the street, a small house suddenly comes out and a longing comes from the smoke of cooking. Soft and static. Fluffy clouds are hanging over the roofs of the countryside.
Literature
Seocheon's exotic experience village lies in a cozy and cozy valley at the foot of Hwayang Mountain.
Literature
Mok-eun, who was a supportive Confucian scholar who did not serve the two kings, is the place where the literature scribe, where the teacher of Saek-suk bloomed, is also a place where you can experience unique and touching experiences.
Literature
Because you can experience two different experiences, you can learn and experience different cultures and styles.
Literature
The unique village of Seocheon Botanical Arts Center (041-951-1072), which became famous when the director Kim Jae-wan, who retired from the principal of the elementary school, released the Onggi, Sodadae, and Bonsai collected for over 40 years, became the base, and the entire village was transformed into an experience village. did. In the Seocheon Botanical Arts Center, expensive bonsai is not on display, but there are many bonsais that are simple but feel the elegance of Mr. Kim. Next to the Bonsai Art Museum is the Onggi Exhibition Hall, where over 1,000 ceramic bowls collected by Kim Won-jang have been placed in various forms.
Seocheon Bizarre Experience Village
In the labyrinth garden, there is a uniquely shaped labyrinth, and you can also visit the agricultural museum where you can trace the history of agricultural culture. When it's time to eat during the market season, you can immerse yourself in the different flavors by eating bicolor kalguksu, which is good for your body.
Seocheon Bizarre Experience Village
The reed forest in Seocheon is called the 4th reed forest nationwide along with the reed forest in Suncheon Bay, Jeollanam-do. It is also considered as the 'Korean Reed 7' by the Korea Tourism Organization. The size of the reed field, as well as the sight of the reed swaying in the wind, is truly spectacular. The landscape of the reed field was so difficult that it was the background of the movie JSA. The scene of Lee Byung-hun's first encounter with North Korean soldier Song Kang-ho takes place in this reed field. It is also the location of the TV drama Chuno, Sorry. The reed field is harmonious with the Geumgang water and the sunlight. It is also famous for its migratory colony. During the winter, Goni and Mallards swarm in reed forests.
Sinseong-ri Reed Field
Seocheon is home to many wetlands and reed forests. In addition to the reed forests in Sinseong-ri, you can easily find the flowers blooming in colonies of fishing villages and gaet villages along the Seocheon coast. Seocheon has a different appearance in each season. In spring, the sound of life tumbling in the forest of reeds. In summer, the cool river breeze that has passed through the lush leaves cools the heat, and in the fall, the reed, with its head bowed at the end of the wind, feels the weight. In winter, it is sad and sad.
Sinseong-ri Reed Field
The time to taste the essence of reed forest is also autumn. Among them, from late October to November, you can fully enjoy the reeds. Benches and trails are provided between the reed forests, allowing you to enjoy the reeds comfortably.
Sinseong-ri Reed Field
The Hansan Mosikan also has a special feeling. Seocheon is a place where ramie was developed from the past. Hansan ramie is a high-grade sashimi produced in the area of Hansan-myeon, Seocheon-gun, Chungcheongnam-do. It is the fusion of the wisdom of our nation that can overcome the heat with a cool linen of red and red ginseng on a summer day. Seosan's Hansan Ramie is one of the major essences of our national culture, which is important enough to be registered as a National Intangible Cultural Heritage No. 14 and listed as a UNESCO human intangible cultural heritage (28 November 2011).
Hansan City Hall
The tangled narrative of Hansan Moshi dates back to the Three Kingdoms period. An old man climbed a medicinal herb to Mt. Geonji and found ramie grass. It started to cultivate ramie, and in the Joseon Dynasty, it was designated as a tribute to souvenirs from the Hansan area. If you make a loom on the loom, it looks like ramie will come out, but in fact, ramie is a fabric that requires a great deal of labor. Peel the skin from the stem of the linen, pick out only the soft flesh, dry it in the sun, and soak it in water for 1 to 2 hours to make a very soft tamoshi. Tamoshi is placed between the teeth, scraped into small pieces, and then placed on the mold with linen fibers and then glued together using the saliva of each lip to make soshigut.
Inside the Hansan Mosikan
It doesn't end there. Loosen the ramie good, wind the thread enough to squeeze the ramie, put the ramie thread and feed the soybean grass to make the ramie smooth. It is only necessary to put this on a loom to complete Hanpil's ramie. It is very painful to squeeze the arm, and the tooth hurts to tear off the mossy. The process of making Taemoshi, putting it in a loom, and weaving it was a process of labor, so it was said that 'a dead tree is a man'. So tradition was born and passed on.
Statue of Hansan Mosikan
When the sunset glows red, the scenery of the Geum River Estuary is superb. The Geumgang Estuary Bank is a dam constructed by blocking the 401 km of the estuary of the Geum River originating from Ongdalsam, Jangsu-gun, Jeollabuk-do.
Geum River Estuary
In winter, migratory birds, which embroider the sky in black, form a tripod, leaving for a distant foreign country.
Geum River Estuary
Migratory birds become a moving picture. The migratory birds flying on the water and on the ground sometimes stir up strange emotions.
Seocheon Bird Ecology Center
The day of Seocheon, where more beautiful people live in beautiful nature, flowed down in the red twilight.
Seocheon Bird Ecological Center

item.title: The “shellfish” that resembles a bird's beak… Chewy and sweet winter delicacy - Hongseong-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea
item.description:
The “shellfish” that resembles a bird's beak… Chewy and sweet winter delicacy

Hongseong-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea

Winter is a delicious season. Although it seems relatively weak due to the richness of autumn and the scent of spring, there are many delicacies that can only be tasted in winter. The frozen river stalks are smelt, wild, and trout, and the salty waterfront offers oysters and fish filled with snow crab and guamegi. This winter, overflowing with delicious food, the 'flavor' of traveling is cold even on cold days. Gilson's worries are gathered in one way in the face of the true 'Gourmet Season'. Go where you go and taste something!

Under the premise that there is no difference in 'taste', let's prepare a winter gourmet trip. It is cold, so I wish I could do it on a day trip. First, whether it's fresh or salty, that's the problem. The fresh water is good, but I decided to choose the beach in anticipation that the food would be richer in salty water. Why is the winter sea so attractive to people on land? First, I plan to taste the chewy winter sea and shoot the sea breeze in my body and mind, which I finally put on my lower neck. Now, let's go to the delicious beach where you can take a day trip!

Delicious West Coast Stem's representative winter delicacy, cockle

The Korean Peninsula, with three sides in the sea. Today's destination is Namdang Port in Hongseong, South Chungcheong Province. It is a prosperous town that offers a variety of foods in each season because it touches Cheonsu Bay, which is dug deeply between Anmyeondo and Cheon. Before the new clam season begins, in the fall, people who want to taste Daeha, trout, and blue crabs are gathered.

Winter scenery of Hongseong Namdang Port

Take the West Coast Expressway to Hongseong IC and run for 20 minutes to reach Namdang Port. It is a delicious port where 'festivals', featuring local seasonal food as the main character, unfold every season. During this cold windy season, the main character of the Namdang Port Winter Festival is the new clam. The Hongseong Namdang Port Bird Clam Festival, which marks its 10th anniversary this year, will be held until March 31. This year, the catch was reduced due to the cold, and the price increased, but there are still many who are looking for a fresh clam in the mountains.

Winter scenery of Hongseong Namdang Port
Let's take a look around Namdang Port for a while before going on a full-scale bird clam tour. A beach that, like any coast of the Southwest Sea, reveals a sensual feeling depending on the tide, and hides it with seawater. Far away, some fishing boats are slumbering with the sea breeze over the tidal flats that shyly exposed even the breakwater. Soaking in the peaceful view of the West Sea is a short while, and the path continues to the exciting new cockle festival.
Winter scenery of Hongseong Namdang Port
Dozens of stalls are lined up around the Namdang Marine and Fisheries Complex, which is scheduled to open in March. Like a food festival, the atmosphere is exciting. The hula hoop competition is taking place on the outdoor stage because it is a weekend, but there are more people filling the stalls than the stage. Where to enter? The prices are all the same, so you can just go where you like it.
A restaurant owner is grooming a cockle
The owners of the stalls have no hesitation in handling the cockle, and every house is full of people who come to taste the cockle. The shell of the cockle that is being groomed is the shape of a beak of an eternal bird. It's like the name 'bird clam. But where did it look famous only? The chewy and sweet taste is also excellent. If you are a lover, you will be eager to think of a drink in this passage.
A cockle in a basket
The owner of the stand at Namdang Port said, "It is best to catch the cockle between January and March." Also, don't forget the promotion of "The cockle is a little expensive, but come to taste a lot."
The brown flesh looks like a bird's beak.
A chewy, sweet flesh, resembling a bird's beak
Let's take a moment to look at his identity before tasting the cockle. It is often said that it resembles a bird's beak, but it is said that it is said that swimming in the water is as fast as a bird. Unfortunately, this part has not been confirmed. All the new clams that I met at the Namdang Port were piled up in the barrel and kept in constant care. Still, the nature seems to be unusual. When I touched it, I aggressively squirreled the brown beak. It is your own body with a look, taste, and a tough personality.
Another reason to increase its value to the fullest is that it is impossible to form. A new clam that lives only in clean waters is taken out of the boat by scratching the floor with a mesh. It is a delicacy that goes hand in hand in many ways.
The basic idea that comes out when you order a new clam

Those who have tasted the chewy and sweet cockle, which has a distinct difference from other shellfish, will never forget it. It is the same reason that those who confront the cockle and flock to the Namdang Port in winter. It is popular as a diet food due to its low calorie and fat content as well as taste and aroma. It is also rich in essential amino acids, taurine and calcium. The explanation is enough now, so let's taste it.

Scallops and oysters come first with broth
It is best to eat the cockle with a soft chocolate beak cooked in water (soaked). You can eat it raw according to your taste, but why not eat it as the winter food poisoning 'norovirus' is polar? If the broth added with radish and cabbage comes out first, you can boil it with a little bit of seaweed and add it to taste, adding soy sauce, soy sauce, and ssamjang.
When the trimmed cockle comes out, cook it in broth
At first, the broth that had been mingling has a new clam, and it turns into a 'rich broth' with a rich taste and coolness. If you add garlic and peppers to be added to ssam, the broth becomes more delicious. If you add the broth just before eating Kalguksu, the taste is Doromita. It is better to add them in advance. If you want Orot to taste the scent of bird shellfish, you can taste it.
When the trimmed cockle comes out, cook it in broth
The cockle is delicious. It is crisp in life and has a stronger taste. The shabu-shabu wrapped in cooked cabbage is also excellent. It tastes good, it's comfortable and it's good for your body. However, the price is a little expensive. To taste the cockle, you need to eat 1kg for 2 people. Don't eat all the shabu-shabu, but leave a few points and add it when you add Kalguksu-sari to the broth.
Raw cockle
Oysters and scallops are served as a service in addition to new clams. It is also special to cook them while waiting for a new clam. You can still taste the fresh jukkumi at 40,000 won for 1kg even though you haven't taken it yet. The extra noodles are 3,000 won.
Slightly cooked cockle
If you're immersed in the charm of the new cockle, go to Gwangcheon Market, which is not far away. You can buy various chopped salts aged in crypts at low prices.
Cooked cabbage and added clams
Hongseong is mostly inland except Namdang Port, so if you want to travel the winter sea, it is good to move along the west coast of Chungnam, which extends up and down. The destination expands across the coast of Chungnam. If you're with a lover, I recommend you to take a look at the grandmother's rock at Anmyeondo Beach.
Bird clams eaten in the grass
This winter, there is also Boryeong Cheonbuk Guldan, not far from Namdang Port if you are with friends. Didn't there be an old saying, "It's good to have a ghost when you eat and die?" Let's go hand in hand with a friend. It is delicious in winter.
Lastly, add the noodles to the broth.
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

Metropolitan West Coast Expressway → Hongseong IC → National Road No. 29 → Hongseong

* public transport

Metropolitan Area → Hongseong Operates 8 times (06: 40 ~ 20: 40) daily from Central City Terminal (02-6282-0114). Rate Normal 9100 won, 13,400 won. It takes 2 hours.

2. Restaurants around

Every year, in winter, the 'Sea Shell Festival' is held at Namdang Port in Hongseong. Many people are looking for a precious cockle as a food festival that can be enjoyed in the mountains. You can taste the cockle in about 30 stalls spread out in front of Namdang Port. If you don't like stalls, there are several restaurants nearby. You can go anywhere you like, as it provides services similar to the same price wherever you go. Eating locally is 50,000 won per kg, and packing is 40,000 won. Prices fluctuate little by little every year.

3.Accommodation

Namdang Hill Pension: Namdang-ri, Seobu-myeon / 041-634-7723
Namdang Port S Motel: Namdang-ri, Seobu-myeon / 041-634-9222
Yongbongsan Natural Recreation Forest: Yongbongsan 2-gil, Hongbuk-myeon / 041-630-1785
Hongseong Hot Spring Tourist Hotel: Ohseong-eup, Hongseong-eup / 041-633-7777

item.title: Call it Ogye, not Ogolgye, Nonsan Yeongye - Nonsan, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea
item.description:
The five worlds are released and raised.

Call it Ogye, not Ogolgye, Nonsan Yeongye

Nonsan, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea

If you follow National Highway No. 4 from Daejeon to Nonsan, cultural heritages that have a rich history, such as Gaetae Temple, Donam Seowon, Huangsanbeol, and Gwantuksa, were scattered. There is a sign that stands out along the way. It is a sign of ‘Oggye of Yeonsan Hwaak-ri’ designated as Natural Monument No.265. There is a uniqueness that is different from Ogol, and a special taste that can be tasted in a nutritional style that does not fit the name of a natural monument. Let's meet the five worlds, the black ones in the ear.

Your name is black in my ears
In the vicinity of Gaetae Temple, which was founded under the name of Wang Geon, there is a Jisan Farm where you can meet the five worlds of Yeonhwa Hwaak-ri, one of the natural monuments. Among the natural monuments in Korea, there are livestock animals that are kept and managed in the hands of humans, and all six species, including Jeju black cattle, are designated as natural monuments this year. This is a livestock animal designated as a natural monument along with Jindo dog (No. 53), Jindo dog (No. 53), Jeju Jeju (No. 347), Gyeongsan spade dog (No. 368), and Gyeonggyeong dog Donggyeongi (No. 540). .
The five chickens of Yeonhwa Hwaak-ri were recognized as typical Korean chickens and were designated as a natural monument No. 265 in 1980. Chickens were originally known to have entered South Korea from Southeast Asia via China. Although the inflow route is not well known, it is considered to have been indigenous to the present state after entering Korea. The appearance of the five worlds in the literature is the collection of ‘Jejeongjip’ by Jeong Dal-chong, the late Koryo tattoo. It is also said that after the reign of King Sukjong in Joseon and regained his health, he became a true product in the Chungcheong area. The closest record is that Hyung-Hum Lee of the Ministry of Government Administration and Home Affairs in Jinsan was told to Cheoljong. Hyung-Hum Lee is the fifth grandfather of Seung-Sook Lee, CEO of Jisan Farm, a designated breeder of Oggy.
Kennel
The five worlds are clearly confused with the five worlds, although they are clearly different from the most commonly known. The Ogol system is a natural monument of Japan, and the hair is white while the bone is black and is called Ogol system. Introducing Oggy in the 1936 Dong-A Ilbo during the Japanese colonial period, it is still known that it was called Ogol Gye and confused. Korean native chickens are not Ogol, but Oggy. When Yoo Hong-jun was the director of the Cultural Heritage Administration, the name changed from Ogol-gye to Ogye-gye.
A wonderful look
The five worlds of Yeonhwahwa-ri have unique characteristics. First of all, not only the appearance, but also the bones are black. In Donguibogam, Geumsu edition, it is said that when a chicken's eyes are black, the bones are necessarily black. In addition to the hair, the five worlds are black with feet, crests, pupils and brows, skin and bones. If you look at it quietly, even though the whole is black, there is a bluish energy, but the color is very beautiful and subtle.
Five hens
The five worlds are sensitive and demanding enough to be close to wild birds. It is said that if kept in captivity, it is difficult to keep it because it can cause stress and death. Moreover, the growth rate is about 5 times slower than that of ordinary chickens, and the five chickens lay one every four to five days compared to the chickens that lay eggs one day. Although he is small and has good activity, he said in a saying, “A guy with a small body doesn't gain weight after running around. As a result, the five worlds are less economical. In the 1970s, with the introduction of poultry, the five worlds gradually began to culminate.
Five-year roosters are about 30% larger than hens.
Five Worlds Fly with Natural Monuments
Oggy was designated as a natural monument in 1980. In the designation of the natural monument, it was said to be "to prevent the extinction of the Ogol system, a rare livestock animal in Korea." It was said that there were only a few remaining even when it was designated as a natural monument. Oggy has been raised and managed for over 30 years in two generations since it was designated as a natural monument. It was difficult because the breeding was difficult and there was no support.
Jisan Farm's CEO, Seung-sook Lee, came down in 1999 to take care of his father's illness, and set foot here. He confessed that he had robbed his family enough to cancel insurance, and that he was sick because he was called as the owner of the Samgyetang house, not a designated breeder of natural monuments.
Five eggs that I met at the spawning ground
The most dangerous for group breeding animals is an epidemic. In particular, avian influenza (AI) is the most terrifying disease for the five worlds. This is because 1,000 predators, designated as natural monuments, can be exterminated at once. So, in the past few years, such as 2006 and 2008, the evacuation procession of the five worlds continued to Dongducheon, Gyeonggi-do, Muuido, Incheon, and Bonghwa and Sangju, Gyeongbuk. In 2012, the five worlds that had to go to evacuation were also bound by local governments' backlash.
A breeding ground with five breeding sites designated as natural monuments
The process is very difficult for the five worlds to become natural monuments. There are more than 20 species standards such as height and crest color. The breeder who passed the standard selects 350 to 500 animals per year with a male to female ratio of 8 to 2, and keeps 1,000 animals each year.
A breeding ground with five breeding sites designated as natural monuments
Taste the natural monument, Ogye
Jisan Farm, which breeds and manages the five worlds, also runs a restaurant called 'Stepmother's Happy Table.' You can try the five seasons here, but don't get me wrong. For the preservation of the lineage of the Osan Hwaak-ri five worlds, at least 1,000 species are designated as natural monuments to be protected and reared, and others are edible. In other words, only Oh Gye, who has been pushed out of the world of weak meat, is on the table.
“Stepmother's Happy Table” where you can taste the five worlds
In the stepmother's happy meal, it is divided into the general five and the five o'clock, and the soup is cooked. It is more accurate to say that it is a medicine rather than a food. The five worlds are divided into two categories: Oja chicken (Oggy rooster) and Oung chicken (Oggy hen) in ‘Geumsu’ of 《Donguibogam》 《Tang liquid edition》. According to the contents, the oggy is warm, sweet, and has no poison, so it makes the fetus comfortable, reports weakened postpartum, and gives good milking, making it especially good for pregnant women and mothers.
Abalone Baeksuk made with Yeonsan Oggy
The abalone Baeksuk made with Yeonsan Oggy is raked with a lacquer and astragalus and chopped over an hour. Due to the nature of the five worlds, which are black to the bone, Baeksukdo is also black.
Ojeon Oggy Abalone Baeksuk Sang
In general, Baeksuk has soggy bones and flesh, while Oggy Baeksuk retains its original form of skin, bones, and flesh. The skin is chewy and the flesh is sue. The bones are hard enough to be orphaned. Oggy Baeksuk has a soup that is enough to eat the soup even if it leaves fat. After eating the grilled ogre eggs and the last chicken porridge, it feels like the energy rises.
Jisan Farm CEO Seung-Sook Lee
The five seasons of Yeonhwa Hwaak-ri were listed in the “Ark of Taste” this year along with Jeju's Green Beans, Pearl's Snack Mill, and Ulleungdo's Samso and Island Malna.
Pickled pickles in the stepmother's happy meal
'Ark of Taste' is a certification project of the Biodiversity Foundation, headquartered in Italy, and is the name of 'Noah's Ark' in the Bible. It is a project to rediscover the taste of food that is forgotten all over the world and find and nurture endangered species and food. 1,211 species from 76 countries around the world are listed in the ‘Ark of Taste’.
Chicken porridge after eating abalone
The five worlds of Yeonhwa Hwaak-ri have been named on the list of Korea's natural monuments thanks to their three generations of sincerity and effort. Although it is true that it has attracted attention by being listed on the ‘Ark of Taste’, it is a natural monument that desperately needs attention.
Roasted Oyster Egg

item.title: Ganggyeong Fermented Salted Salt Festival “Come to taste the delicious fermented salted salted fish!” - Nonsan, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea
item.description:
There is a bonus at the festival. You also have to pay for the oil!

Ganggyeong Fermented Salted Salt Festival “Come to taste the delicious fermented salted salted fish!”

Nonsan, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea

Kang Kyung, who once occupied the “three major markets of Joseon” with Pyongyang and Daegu, still remembers the revival of the time with the “Fermented Salted Salt Festival” every fall. The presence of a large market meant that there were a lot of goods and people coming and going. Thanks to him, Kang Kyung is also a living 'History Museum'. At the “Ganggyeong Fermented Jeotgal Festival”, the 17th anniversary of this year in 2013, we toured the history of Ganggyeong as well as various salted fish. Indifferent silver grass on the banks of the Geumgang River floating on the Hwangpo Sail Boat greets people.

Until October 20th, the 'Ganggyeong Fermented Jeotgal Festival' will be held at Ganggyeong Pogu, nearby Jeotgal Market, and the village of Oknyeobong. What is the taste of chopped salt that has been matured and fermented by traditional methods that have been practiced for centuries? There are not many people who gathered with curiosity from the first day of the festival. As I am looking at the festival hall, it seems like I came back to the peak of Ganggyeongpo-gu about 100 years ago. The history of Ganggyeong, where more than a hundred boats went in and out during the season, is depicted as a temple.

The 'Ganggyeong Fermented Salted Salt Festival', the 17th anniversary of this year
The muzzle that once flourished, Ganggyeong
In order to know Ganggyeong Pogu, he must first look at the stem of the Geumgang he held. The Geumgang, which reaches the Cheonri, originates from Sinmu Mountain in Jangsu, Jeollabuk-do, and passes through the princess and Buyeo to dig into the river. The Geumgang stem splits between Chungnam and Jeonbuk until it reaches Ganggyeong and mixes with the West Sea. Located on the lower reaches of the Geumgang River, Kanggyeong is the deepest inland in the West Sea.
Oknyeobong from Ganggyeongpo-gu
'Ganggyeong Pogu' plays an important role in the position of Ganggyeong where fresh and salt water flows. It was the largest fishing port on the west coast and the main point of transportation between Chungcheongdo and Jeolla-do. People flocked by waterways and by land, followed by supplies. It was also a passageway for seawater to enter the inland, making it a perfect destination for marine products.
Entrance to the festival hall
The development of civilization was also rapid. It was said that it was equipped with electric water supply facilities in the 1920s, so it was once a place that achieved a really fast “modernization” on the Korean Peninsula. So far, the old buildings that remained all over town in Ganggyeong weren't the latest buildings at the time.
Entrance to the festival hall
Banks and theaters also entered early, and Daejeon, Buyeo, Gongju, and Gunsan were in strong commercial areas. The former Hanil Bank Ganggyeong Branch (No. 324), Ganggyeong Labor Union (No. 323), Ganggyeong North Korean Methodist Church (No. 42), the former Namildang Oriental Medicine (No. 10), Ganggyeong Central Elementary School (No. 60), the former Ganggyeong Public Commercial High School Officer (No. 322), etc., hold their position and prove this. However, it is also true that it is not easy to remember the old movies of Kang Kyung after seeing them so lonely.
Photo exhibition showing the old look of Kang Kyung

The shining days of Ganggyeong end in 1914 when the Janghang Line railroad was laid down and the Korean War was fought. As it was a big city, the damage of the war was great, and the development of overland transportation weakened the position of Ganggyeong Pogu. So a long time passed. Ganggyeong has become a quiet and small town, regardless of its prestige. The 'Ganggyeong Fermented Salted Salt Festival', which can remember the 'Ganggyeong' in its heyday, is only a relief. It is thanks to those who remember the film at the time, and the natives who took hold of the river after generations.

An exhibition showing the history of hard work

“Why is Ganggyeong Salted Salt famous?”
If you hold on to the merchants you meet at the festival venue and ask, anyone will respond. It is thanks to everyone who saw the heyday of this place or heard it through his mother.

Participants who came out to buy ‘Jetgal’

“When the meat boats went in and out of muzzle here, then. Seafood is overflowing. If you let these go, you're all injured. That's why it's salted. Then you can leave and eat for a long time. There are a lot of salted fish markets around here, right? This neighborhood is an old-fashioned riverside muzzle. It's changed a lot now, but there's a waterway in front of that apartment over there. ”

Participants who came out to buy ‘Jetgal’
The salty salted salt keeps moving!
Now that we have reviewed the history of Ganggyeong, let's go on a full-scale festival tour. Among the strongest salted salted fish, shrimp is the first choice. From 'yukjeot' in June, 'oot' in May, and 'chuot' in autumn. There are three types of shrimp sauce.
Salted kimchi experience center where you can try making kimchi yourself
Of these, boiled and boasted flesh is the most precious body. Serve the best of the shrimp sauce. It is too expensive to make kimchi, so sprinkle it with sesame oil and eat it as a side dish.
Salted kimchi experience center where you can try making kimchi yourself
After that, there is Otteo and Chuteo. The color is gradually reddening and squeezing. The price difference is also substantial. Per kg is 30,000 won for salted fish, 15,000 won for fried fish, and 10,000 won for chute.
Salted kimchi experience center where you can try making kimchi yourself
Do not be surprised that it is too expensive. There is a 'dumb' inside the festival hall. Don't miss the ‘service’ that takes care of the price of oil, bachelor in front, and share of virgin in back. Also, keep in mind that you can taste cheaper ones with shrimps of different sizes. The sweet potato provided for tasting salty salted fish tastes quite good.
Experience Ticket Office
In addition to this, a wide variety of salted fish such as octopus, clam, squid, and scallops arouse the appetite. A bowl of rice is also possible for tasting.
White and plump shrimps
White and plump shrimps
Anchovy
If you've been watching salted fish, let's go to the ‘Ganggyeong Fermented Salted Salt Festival’, an ambitious work, and the salted kimchi experience. You can purchase cabbage kimchi at 12,000 won for 4 kg, 25,000 won at 10 kg, and bachelor kimchi at 10,000 won for 3 kg. You can add seasoning to the pre-cleaned ingredients and put them in a bucket. Those who want it, season it yourself, and if you don't want it, festival assistants make it. It is limited to 50 people a day, so if you find a festival, move quickly. In addition to this, the lobster catcher (entry fee of 2000 won) is also popular.
Salted and all you can eat buffet for 10,000 won per person
There is no worry even if you go out. A wide variety of foods excite the festival. In particular, the ‘Steak Buffet’ is a popular dish, where you can enjoy a variety of salted fish, meat, and rice at 10,000 won per person. If you like salted fish, you might want to stop by.
Salted and all you can eat buffet for 10,000 won per person
There are also various side events such as live performances of reeds, autumn concerts in Ganggyeongpo-gu, Pogurak Festival, and children's song festivals nationwide.
Events for children
One more thing, don't miss the stem of the Geum River that climbs overlooking Oknyebong. This is the point where you can feel the autumn in the salted fish festival.
Events for children

item.title: Taean Flavor vs. Flavor, Druni Port Jukkumi vs Baeksajang Port - Taean-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea
item.description:
Druni Port Chukumi Shabu Shabu of Chungnam Fisheries

Taean Flavor vs. Flavor, Druni Port Jukkumi vs Baeksajang Port

Taean-gun, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea

Jukkumi Shabu Shabu and Geukji. Which one of the two will make travelers' tastes stronger? If you are curious about the answer, let's go to Taean, Chungnam.
At Druni Port in Nam-myeon, Jukkumi Shabu-shabu, and in Anmyeon-do White Sand Harbor, Geukji-ji awaits evaluation by travelers. Recently, a maritime footbridge that connects the two ports together has emerged as a new tourist attraction in Taean.
Geukji of Eugene Society Center of Baeksajang Port
Drini Port was called Shinon Port 10 years ago.
Just before enjoying the Cheonsuman tidal wave drive and entering Naman-myeon, Taean-gun, just before crossing the Anmyeon-do road, there is a notice board that says “Drni Port”. A small muzzle appears when you follow the path with the thought, 'Your name is unique?' At first glance, it may seem like a foreign language, but the name “Drnihang” is a pure Korean word that means “to stop”. During the Japanese colonial period, it was called the Chinese character for Shin-on Port, and it regained its original name since 2003.
The port of Drni facing the White Sands Port is a small, quiet port. When you climb north along the coast from Druni Port, you will see a coastal trekking course with the name “Solmorat-gil” to Cheongpodae, Dalsanpo, and Mongsanpo. The beautiful scenery of the West Sea is intact and the scenery is spectacular. The exotic appearance of aerobatic planes sometimes unfolds.
The leisurely scenery of Drní Port
Although it is a small port, there is a shrimp farm nearby, so Drini Port is rich in food. A fisherman grooms a fishing net with shells around the port where several boats are anchored. When asked what it was used for, such a fishing net is said to be a fishing net for fishing. When the jukkumi enters the seashell to spawn, the fishermen raise the seashell. In the past, I thought it was caught a lot in the spring, but nowadays it is said to be caught in the winter.
Sandbars deposited off the coast of Dreni
I'm possessed by the umami shabu shabu
Jukkumi, such as roasted pork belly, stir-fried pork belly, and shabu-shabu, delights travelers with a variety of recipes. The shabu-shabu is the right answer to get a good texture from among various foods. Is it too much expression if the strong vitality of Jukkumi, who violently wriggles even before entering the soup pot, further stimulates the appetite?
Add radish, kelp, green onion, and pearl clam, and put the whole jukkeumi, which has just been dried out of the aquarium, into the boiled broth. As soon as it enters boiling water, it changes from a dark color to a red color. When the color changes, separate the head and legs. The restaurant owner explains that the head should be cooked more in boiling water, and the legs should be cooked slightly, and then dip in the red pepper paste. When you pop your head, the soup turns black all over because of the ink. The light jujukumi leg gives a sweet taste and delights the mouth. When the head of the intestine is cooked, it is savory and rich.
Jjukkumi just brought out of the aquarium
It is also fun to put on a mouth-watering pearl shellfish in the Saisai soup. Fishermen in this area are also called liberation clams. Liberation clams are said to have eaten a lot in the year of liberation. While boiling in boiling water, the silky clam, which gradually becomes yellowish in color, has a beautiful color and sweet taste. If you chew the light clams, you won't know when it has passed into your throat.
Jukkumi head on top of silk clam
week...
Maritime footbridge seen from the port of Drini
There are spiral driveways on both sides of the port. The pure cable-stayed bridge is 250m long. By making a steering system in the middle of the bridge, anyone can taste the feeling of being a captain of the ship, and transparent reinforced plastics on both sides can feel the sea.
Midway point of maritime footbridge
If you look at the west while looking at the gaze, the vast West Sea spreads out. The island floating right in front of you is Karma Island, and if you run alone, you will reach the land of China. When you stand in the middle of the bridge facing the West Sea, you can see the white sand beach on the left and Gom Island on the right. This maritime footbridge has become a new sunset spot in Taean-gun. When the sun goes down, night lights show like Busan Gwangan Bridge and Yeosu Dolsan Bridge.
Maritime footbridge seen from the white sandy beach
The latest delicacy of Baeksajang Port, Geukjiji
Baeksajang Port is the largest port in Anmyeondo. From the driveway leading to the port, there are many sushi shops and aquatic product sales centers. The most prominent menu at this restaurant these days is Geukji. Geukji-ji, which is called get-gukji, get-guk-ji, and sesame-guk-ji, means kimchi with crab soup or seafood broth. Nowadays, the variety of food has been changed, and now it has been transformed into kimchi or crab stew with dipping sauce.
On the Taean Peninsula, where seafood is abundant, crabs have been soaked since ancient times. After picking up the ingredients from the crab shop, the remaining broth was kept, and then the crab was made again by adding more sea urchins caught in the tidal flat. Protein and minerals naturally melt in the broth soaked with crabs and crabs several times. This broth was born as a soup that is rich in taste and nutrition, and was used as a seasoning when soaking kimjang again.
Shrimp, pumpkin, etc.
Kimjang Kimchi, which was mixed with Getkuk and pumpkin, was called Geukji in Taean. When it was cooked to some extent, it boiled like a soup, but the salty taste of Getkuk and the sweetness of the pumpkin combined to create a fantastic harmony. This is Geganji, Taean's native food. The recipe that used a lot of broth when it was difficult is the first publicity of the birth of Geukji. It tastes delicious now, but it is gaining popularity as a food that reminds me of nostalgia during difficult times.
Deep-fried crab and shrimp in the white sand port
Geukji, which is currently tasted at Baeksajang Port, seems to be somewhat different from the original local food. Will recipes evolve? Geukji in the Baeksajang Port is a kind of seafood soup boiled with blue crab, lobster, and pumpkin sweet potato in an old jjigae. This is a soup made of anchovies and green onions with boiled water, enoki mushrooms, anemone pumpkin sweet potato and blue crab. The thick soup of ripe kimchi kimchi and the sweet taste of blue crab make a delicate combination. The soup is so rich that you don't know how long you emptied a bowl of rice. Even when the boat is down and puts the spoon down, it is regrettable that the spoon is pushed into the soup again.
White sand beach scenery
When you take a walk on a maritime footbridge and look at the white sandy beach, the boat comes out. In this case, the delicious snacks such as fried deep-fried crab, deep-fried crab, and fried pumpkin sweet potatoes make the mouthwatering.
Baeksajang Port Restaurant Street
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

Seohaean Expressway Hongseong IC → Cheonsuman Seawall → National Route 77 → Dreni Port → Baeksajang Port

* public transport

10 times a day (07: 10-20: 10) from Seoul Central City Terminal to Taean Terminal, takes 2 hours and 10 minutes. Take the bus bound for Nammyeon from Taean Public Bus Terminal and get off at Sinon-ri or Baeksajang Port (Taean Passenger 041-675-6672)

http://www.lisong.co.kr/
